[View code on GitHub](https://github.com/nethermindeth/nethermind/Nethermind.Serialization.Json/BloomConverter.cs)

The code provided is a C# class called `BloomConverter` that extends the `JsonConverter` class from the `Newtonsoft.Json` library. This class is responsible for serializing and deserializing `Bloom` objects to and from JSON format. 

A `Bloom` object is a probabilistic data structure used in Ethereum to represent a set of values. It is commonly used to store the logs of events emitted by smart contracts. The `BloomConverter` class provides a way to convert `Bloom` objects to and from JSON format, which is useful for storing and transmitting data in a standardized format.

The `BloomConverter` class has two methods: `WriteJson` and `ReadJson`. The `WriteJson` method takes a `JsonWriter`, a `Bloom` object, and a `JsonSerializer` as input. It converts the `Bloom` object to a hexadecimal string using the `ByteArrayToHexViaLookup32Safe` method from the `Nethermind.Core.Extensions` namespace, and writes the string to the `JsonWriter`. 

Here is an example of how to use the `WriteJson` method:

```
Bloom bloom = new Bloom(new byte[] { 0x01, 0x02, 0x03 });
string json = JsonConvert.SerializeObject(bloom, new BloomConverter());
// json = "
